title: kungen12321
author: kungen12321
content: Hi guys!I have an innosilicon T3+ miner. I have been looking for an aftermarket firmware, like Braiins and Hiveon for Antminer.Are there any, if so which ones do you use and can you recommend?Thanks in advance!/Magnus

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Have you checked their website for the firmware? If not yet then check this link below - https://www.innosilicon.com/html/support_en/download.html If you are looking for upgrade guide you can also check this guide - https://www.zeusbtc.com/articles/asic-miner-troubleshooting/2265-innosilicon-t3-57t-firmware-upgrade

comments.author: kungen12321
comments.body: I have enter the ip address, firmware tab and press update. But guess I have the latest firmware.I was looking more after a firmware with more options like Braiins. To be able to tune each board, change tempature, fans.....I google and search on youtube but nothing comes up, maybe because of a reason?

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Currently, there is no custom/modded firmware available for this unit maybe in the future awesomeminer is planning to support it.Or maybe find someone to swap your miner to Bitmain units because this unit is more flexible than other units like whatsminer, innosilicon, and Avalon.

comments.author: kungen12321
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on April 02, 2023, 06:27:19 PMCurrently, there is no custom/modded firmware available for this unit maybe in the future awesomeminer is planning to support it.Or maybe find someone to swap your miner to Bitmain units because this unit is more flexible than other units like whatsminer, innosilicon, and Avalon.Thanks for that information, then I know:)
